Re ''Traveler's Tricks for Riding Out the Waves of Motion Sickness'' (June 27): I discovered a simple way to avoid seasickness when riding on a small boat between the Greek islands of Mykonos and Delos, a trip famed for its rough ride. All 20 or so passengers, myself included, were grim and pale, fighting seasickness.

Then I discovered the simple answer: let your body sway along with boat's motion in the same direction as the boat. Don't follow your instinct of fighting this by trying to counter the motion in order to stay erect. At that moment I had shed my landlubber status and achieved my sea legs. I had no further symptoms.
